intro: Ornithoboea calcicola, commonly known as the limestone hyacinth, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils, often found in limestone areas. It produces vibrant blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
